reviewText: i love love love forensic files; it is by far one of the best forensic shows on television. however, who's this clown trying to sell one freakin 8 episode dvd set for 125$?!? its 20 bucks at even the most overpriced stores!! i hope noone buys this from the moron trying to rip people off.
summary: DO NOT SPEND MORE THAN $20!! YOU CAN GET IT AT ANY STORE FOR 20 BUCKS!

reviewText: I never get tired of watching Forensic Files.  About as real as crime gets and the processes by which the detectives and forensic inspectors use to solve REAL cases are absolutely fascinating.
summary: One of the better shows out there
Title: N/A

reviewText: I've seen a few different tv documentaries that cover forensic cases, and this series is one of the best.  This collection is especially nice becuase they purposefully picked a wide range of cases.  I was a bit bored by one case or two, but mostly, their selection was wonderful.Notes: often cases involve more than one area of forensics, I'm just picking out the main one I saw in each.Disc 1 features cases involving a bombing (chemical analysis), anthropology, crash reconstruction, viral DNA, document examination, bite mark analysisDisc 2 features chemical analysis of paint chips; gas chromatography and mass spectroscopy; microscopy; DNA, Document Examination; Ballistics/ Soil analysis
summary: Awesome Introduction to Fascinating Applications of Science to Law
Title: N/A

reviewText: I watch Forensic Files every week on the Court Channel, and it's one of my favorite "forensic/crime" shows.  It's great because it allows you to see not only how the crime was committed, but the process that law enforcement had to go through to solve the crime.I love these shows because somehow it makes me feel safer just knowing that every crime can be solved - plus, I'm also extremely interested in forensic science, as well as what drives people to commit such horrible crimes against others."Forensic Files" is great because you're never left hanging - you know going into it that the "bad guy" will be caught.  This makes it easier to endure some of the "stomach-churning" details of the crimes themselves.If you're a crime buff, and enjoy learning about how murders are solved, then this would be a great DVD for you.
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you're a fan of shows like "Investigative Reports (any of the Bill Curtis shows, really), "Body of Evidence", "Cold Case Files" and "City Confidential", I'm sure you'll enjoy "Forensic Files". This is a no-nonsense look at the world of forensic science and the dedicated individuals who use it to solve crimes. I hope all you crime buffs enjoy it as much as I did.

reviewText: I spent a little over 3 hours watching this 2 pack DVD set with my husband.  It was fascinating.  The story "Breaking the mold" is riveting, and made me and my family very thankful that there is not that problem in our house.
summary: What an excellent series! You won't stop watching...
